item.title: Leslie Benzies ‚ÄòOn Leave‚Äô from Build a Rocket Boy as Gerhard Appears to Assume Sole CEO Role
item.content:encoded:
Leslie Benzies, co-founder and co-CEO of Build a Rocket Boy, the developer behind MindsEye, is reportedly on ‚Äòtemporary leave‚Äô from the firm. This was confirmed by the other CEO, Mark Gerhard, who recently revealed an alleged ‚Ç¨1 million plot to sabotage BARB and MindsEye.

Per an email from Gerhard to the wider company, Benzies is taking a ‚Äòwell-earned temporary leave to recharge after more than a year of working around the clock.‚Äô But following that, Gerhard stressed he‚Äôd be guiding the company forward and signed off his email as ‚ÄòCEO‚Äô and not ‚Äòco-CEO‚Äô.

Where Did Leslie Go?

It has been a tough few weeks for the team at Build a Rocket Boy. After the disastrous launch of MindsEye, the studio‚Äôs inaugural game, and several bouts of layoffs, the team was hit again by yet another scandal earlier this month. Leslie Benzies, formerly of Rockstar North fame, found himself accused of sexual assault in a recently uncovered ‚ÄòEpstein file.‚Äô

He categorically denied the assault but confirmed he was in a consensual relationship with his accuser.

In a new report published by GamesIndustry, it was revealed that an email posted by Mark Gerhard after an all-hands call confirmed Leslie Benzies‚Äô temporary departure from the company.

Gerhard worded the email quite strangely, making it sound like the absence might be a little longer than you might assume:

He has our deepest gratitude, and with the leadership team and your support, I will guide us forward.

The report expanded with comments from former and current employees at BARB, one of whom explained:

I don‚Äôt think BARB survives this crisis. I believe the end is coming for BARB, and it‚Äôs not heralded by saboteurs, but by Mark and Leslie themselves.

That was in response to Gerhard‚Äôs claim of having evidence that Build a Rocket Boy and MindsEye were subject to a ruthless and targeted campaign to bring the brand down. Insider Gaming recently published a report detailing this exact claim.

item.title: Apex Legends Breach Introduces New Hardlight Mesh and More
item.content:encoded:
The latest patch update for Apex Legends features new Meshes, audio updates, weapon updates, and so much more.

On February 9, Apex Legends announced the launch of their latest season: Breach. With the new season comes a range of updates, including the all-new Hardlight Mesh. These meshes serve as destructible, breachable windows. They are translucent, block projectiles, and affect player movement.

They allow players to create new entry points and attack angles, and they rebuild after a significant delay following damage. Controller Legends can also reinforce them to become more sturdy and allow them to bunker down, delaying enemy assaults.

In the latest patch, there are also updates to different Legend types. The Fuse type has received major updates, particularly to its ultimate, which now drops a mortar that detonates on impact, then sprays smaller bombs around its landing point. Additionally, they‚Äôre no longer slowed by explosive damage, have faster weapon stow time, and more.

The Apex team described the Catalyst type as ‚Äúneeding help for a while.‚Äù They can now reinforce up to four doors, have a maximum of three traps, and work in a larger area.

Audio Updates Included Also

Additionally, the Apex team announced audio updates for season 28. There are now more audio customization options, providing finer-tuned control over: Legend Dialogue, Ping Dialogue, and Announcer Dialogue.

Players can check out the full patch here.

For more Apex Legends news, learn how much longer Nintendo players have to upgrade to the Nintendo Switch 2 if they want to keep playing Apex Legends on that platform.

item.title: ARC Raiders Shared Watch Event Launches Tomorrow
item.content:encoded:
Embark Studios is encouraging players to team up with strangers in the next ARC Raiders event, which launches tomorrow, February 10.

The Shared Watch event was announced in a social media trailer and will run through February 24.

While not specified, the caption states that players will clean up with strangers to turn their barrels on the machines, hinting at a PvE event. Still, people in the comments were asking for clarification as to whether this would be a PvP event.

What Follows This Event in the ARC Raiders Roadmap

Following the conclusion of the shared watch event on February 24, players can sign up for the second in-game Expedition on February 25. The event will begin on March 1. This time around, ARC is introducing a Skill Point catch-up system, which will allow players to reclaim some coins they missed during the first Expedition.

Each missing Skill Point from the first Expedition now only requires 300k stash value, and any Coins collected will first count toward the second Expedition before being applied to previously missed Skill Points.

Learn more about the upcoming Expedition here.

For more ARC Raiders on Insider Gaming, players can check out the full roadmap for the game through April 2026 here. You can also read comments from the Embark Studios CEO responding to players who may be dissatisfied with the current roadmap here.

Are you excited for the upcoming Shared Watch event? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Remedy Appoints Former EA Exec as CEO
item.content:encoded:
Remedy‚Äôs new CEO is Jean-Charles Gaudechon, who has previously worked at Electronic Arts and CCP Games.

Back in October 2025, it was announced that former Remedy CEO Tero Virtala would step down ‚Äúwith immediate effect‚Äù after nearly a decade at the company. After that, an interim CEO was appointed to oversee matters until the search for a permanent CEO was complete, and that day has finally arrived.

Jean-Charles Gaudechon is Remedy‚Äôs New CEO

A new press release reveals that Remedy Entertainment‚Äôs board of directors has appointed Jean-Charles Gaudechon as the CEO. Gaudechon will be taking that position on March 1, 2026. Until then, Markus M√§ki, the co-founder, will continue his position as interim-CEO until Gaudechon‚Äôs tenure begins.

The new CEO has over 20 years of leadership experience in the global gaming and digital entertainment industry. Gaudechonhas been in senior partnership roles at several international gaming companies and held senior executive positions with full P&L responsibility at Electronic Arts (EA) and CCP Games.

Here‚Äôs what Gaudechon shared in the announcement:

‚ÄúI‚Äôm excited and honored to join Remedy at a pivotal time. The studio has a unique creative identity and a strong pipeline. My commitment is to protect what makes it special, deliver exceptional games, and scale Remedy in a way that builds lasting value. Remedy has the voice and the ambition to be a pillar of the industry‚Äôs future. We will stay close to players, earn their time and trust, and strengthen our independence in how we build and publish our games, while continuing to work closely with the partners who have supported us along the way. I will be moving to Finland with my family and I‚Äôm incredibly excited about getting to work directly with the team at the studio.‚Äù

In other news, Remedy has set a Q2 2026 release window for Control Resonant. What are your thoughts on Remedy‚Äôs new CEO? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.
